item.title: Slides
item.description: This is probably the best place to start to get an overview of things. All of the examples are from the second part of the talk (although they’re now starting to take on a life of their own).

item.title: Example #1: Hello Napier
item.description: Start our web programming journey with a variation of the tradional “Hello World”.

item.title: Example #2: Screen Interaction
item.description: Set the background of the screen to a new and pleasing colour.

item.title: Example #3: Screen Output
item.description: Output some information from JS to the screen, i.e. generate some HTML.

item.title: Example #4: Interacting with the document
item.description: Creating a simple HTML document from JS.

item.title: Example #5: Graphics: Canvas Colour
item.description: Set the colour of the background to a given colour.

item.title: Example #7: Audio - Generate a Tone
item.description: Generate a simple audio tone at a give freqency.

item.title: Example #8: Audio - A Simple Chip-Tune
item.description: One way to play a simple melody…

item.title: Example #9: Audio - A Theremin
item.description: An effort to make a Theremin that uses the cursor position on screen to control the volume and frequency of a generated sound.

item.title: Example #10: Cellular Automata
item.description: A rudimentary Cellular Automata. It only generates a limited number of generations, but illustrates how you can use a couple of functions to interact with the screen and create dynamic output.
